intro: Calyptranthes mornicola, commonly known as the morning glory of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Calyptranthes mornicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
